text:
Tammy, starring Melissa McCarthy, is a comedic ride that leans heavily on the star power and improvisational talents of its lead. While the film is far from perfect, McCarthy’s performance infuses the story with energy, charm, and irreverent humor that keeps audiences engaged even when the screenplay falters.

The film’s screenplay is rough and uneven, often relying on broad jokes and predictable setups. Plot points occasionally feel forced, and narrative structure is inconsistent, leaving some scenes meandering or underdeveloped. However, McCarthy’s comedic instincts elevate the material, transforming otherwise ordinary sequences into memorable, laugh-out-loud moments.

McCarthy brings Tammy to life with a mix of physical comedy, improvisation, and sheer audacity. Her timing and presence make her character both endearing and outrageous, particularly in sequences where she is engaging in reckless antics or petty crime. These moments highlight her ability to command the screen and carry the film despite its structural weaknesses.

The direction struggles at times to maintain focus, contributing to a sense of uneven pacing. Yet, creative choices in certain sequences—such as chaotic road trip setups and slapstick interactions—allow McCarthy to shine. The director’s willingness to give her room to improvise results in scenes that are genuinely entertaining and showcase the actress’s unique comedic talent.

Supporting elements of the film, including secondary characters and situational setups, often serve as scaffolding for McCarthy’s performance rather than fully realized contributions to the story. While this reinforces her centrality, it also underscores the screenplay’s limitations and the film’s reliance on her star power to keep audiences invested.

Ultimately, Tammy is a fun and lively comedy that works primarily because of Melissa McCarthy’s charisma and comedic skills. It may not be a flawless film, and its story and structure leave much to be desired, but for viewers seeking laughs and memorable, over-the-top antics, it delivers an enjoyable, if imperfect, experience.

Filme mais ou menos, o roteiro é fraco, as cenas são mais ou menos, a história é fraca, o elenco é fraco, e ninguém ajuda a melhorar o filme, os personagens são fracos, e o filme deveria ter cenas bem melhores e relevantes, para fazer o filme ser bom

Melissa McCarthy has to be my favorite actress. 

Tammy is easily one of the best movies made 😭😭

Melissa tried to save this film, but the directing was just so bad that it was just a pure cringefest. I came so close to turning the movie off multiple times, which NEVER happens for me. A lot of it was just scripts that were improvised with no actual good attempt at a funny interaction. This was listed as a comedy, but 90% of it was cringe or just sad. It didn't really leave you with a happy or fun feeling. I wouldn't recommend anyone to watch this.
Melisa McCooties can't act and ruins what might have Bern a decent film.
MUST watch movie, always a good option to watch. Great actors and funny plot
One of the worst movies ever created.
What a piece of garbage film - it's Susan Sarandon's 'finest' performance - meaning she is one of the worst parts of the film. Man oh man that one cannot act. Sheesh.
Not great but it is a little better than the strangely hostile negative reviews. It is a great role for McCarthy, crass yet enduring.
I love Melissa MCarthy, but this movie was so cringe I couldn't even watch all of it.  I fast forwarded it through big chunks.   And I NEVER do that.

What an ugly unfunny and all around unpleasant movie.  That doesn't deserve an R rating.  And I'll say again, because they say fuck more than once isn't a reason as we don't live in a fairy tale world.  The word is EVERYWHERE!  I love Melissa McCarthy but the character Tammy is just loud, foul mouthed and a horrible person.  She was such a horrible character I was hoping "Victor Crawley" would show up to give the movie a happy ending. The big heist that all the posters, trailers and TV spots only focused doesn't happen until the middle of the movie and was all of five minutes.  Because the movie is so unfunny and boring.  There was no other real plot to focus on.  It was an unfunny SNL sketch that they stretched 97 minutes.  There is an arch for her but honestly when there this horribly unlikable for so much of the movie, you stop caring frankly before act 1 ends.
Melissa McCarthy was so funny in 2014.
Watched it so many times, laugh every time.

This movie is such a wonderful look at hilarious real women. Of course Melissa McCarthy is hilarious, but there are also a great performance by Susan Sarandon and some really heartfelt look at aging and growing up. I really love this movie - great to watch!
It's one of my favorite comedies so funny I would recommend to anyone that needs a good laugh because life is too serious lol

Yikes. I really wanted to like this movie. The list of top-notch actresses drew me in, but they were miscast. Profanity laced dialog isn't funny. The physical comedy fell short. As did burning and blowing things up for no apparent reason. Skip this one.

Melissa McCarthy calls a spade a spade and that is what makes her movies great - sincerity. This is not a movie made in order to be an epic but watch the pains of human nature softened by humour. Deftly actly and light hearted, an easy watching fun family movie (for older kids because there is a fair bit of swearing). People who rate it low have missed the light-hearted point of the movie.
Melissa McCarthy makes me LMFAO! 🤣 the fast food restaurant scene was the best!
Good fun, typically McCarthy. Enjoyed this a lot
Easily the worst movie I have ever seen. Terribly boring plot and fails at any genuine attempt at humor or entertainment.
